clinical_study.brief_title: Study of DS-7080a for the Treatment of Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration
clinical_study.official_title: PHASE I DOSE ESCALATION AND EXPANSION STUDY OF DS-7080a IN SUBJECTS WITH NEOVASCULAR AGE-RELATED MACULAR DEGENERATION

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test DS-7080a, a monoclonal antibody, as a new treatment for neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD). The hypothesis of the study is that DS-7080a is safe and shows preliminary efficacy in patients with neovascular AMD either alone or in combination with ranibizumab. This study is organized into 2 parts: Part 1 Dose Escalation and Part 2 Dose Expansion. In Part 1, subjects will be enrolled into 3 sequential, ascending dose-level cohorts in non-randomized uncontrolled manner. In Part 2, subjects will be randomized to 1 of 3 arms of either monotherapy with DS-7080a or monotherapy with ranibizumab, which is an active control, or combination therapy of DS-7080a plus ranibizumab (ranibizumab will be administered 30 minutes prior to DS-7080a).

primary_outcome.measure: Number and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.description: To count the number and severity of treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs) during the 12 week course of treatment.
Visual acuity of both eyes will be assessed at all study visits using the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) letter score.

secondary_outcome.measure: DS-7080a reduction in retinal thickness and volume
secondary_outcome.description: anti-neovascularization impact based on a reduction in retinal thickness and volume, as assessed by spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT)
anti-neovascularization impact based on a reduction in retinal leakage, as assessed by fluorescein angiography (FA)
Analysis of plasma samples for DS-7080a concentration determinations will be performed.

arm_group.description: 3 sequential ascending dose levels (1.0, 2.0, 4.0 mg) by intravitreal (IVT) injection of a 50 μL of solution.
Specific dose of DS-7080a will be determined in Part 1 and will be either the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) or 4.0 mg by IVT injection of a 50 μL solution.

intervention.description: 1.0, 2.0, or 4.0 mg by intravitreal (IVT) injection of a 50 μL of solution administered every 4 weeks for 12 weeks.
